title: Verify migration of 5 experimental patterns to main
description:
## Goal
Run end-to-end verification after promoting these 5 patterns from `experiments/` into the main catalog:
- Centralized Rules
- Progressive Disclosure
- Event Automation
- Custom Commands
- Image Spec

## Validation Checklist
### Links & Anchors
- Run internal link validation:
  - `pytest tests/test_links.py -q`
  - `pytest tests/test_readme_accuracy.py -q`
- Repo-wide grep for stale experimental links:
  - `rg "experiments/README.md#(centralized-rules|progressive-disclosure|event-automation|custom-commands|image-spec)" -S .`

### Mermaid Diagrams
- Confirm Mermaid syntax tests pass:
  - `pytest tests/test_diagram.py -q`
- Manually spot-check rendering on GitHub for:
  - `README.md` top overview graph
  - `README.md` “Pattern Dependencies & Implementation Order” diagram
  - Any new diagrams added during promotion

### Pattern Count + Reference Table
- Verify pattern count badge is correct and in sync:
  - `python3 scripts/update-pattern-count.py`
  - Ensure `git diff --exit-code README.md index.html`
- Verify `README.md` Complete Pattern Reference table matches implemented sections:
  - `pytest tests/test_pattern_compliance.py -q`
  - `pytest tests/test_readme_accuracy.py -q`

### Example Directories
- Validate examples are healthy after moving/adding directories:
  - `pytest tests/test_examples.py -q`
- Confirm example directories moved from `experiments/examples/` to `examples/` and all links still resolve.

### Dependencies
- Validate no missing or circular dependencies:
  - `pytest tests/test_dependencies.py -q`
- Confirm dependencies for promoted patterns reference only main patterns (no experimental-only dependencies in the main reference table).

### Experiments Catalog Hygiene
- Confirm `experiments/README.md`:
  - No longer lists the 5 promoted patterns in the experimental reference table.
  - No longer contains the full pattern sections for the 5 patterns.
- Confirm `experiments/examples/README.md`:
  - No longer lists example directories for Centralized Rules / Event Automation / Custom Commands.

### CI Workflow Parity
- Ensure local results match what `.github/workflows/pattern-validation.yml` runs (pattern compliance, readme accuracy, link validation, example validation, dependencies, diagram validation).

## Acceptance Criteria
- All internal links and anchors resolve (no broken links/anchors in `README.md`, `docs/`, `examples/`).
- Mermaid diagrams render without syntax errors; `pytest tests/test_diagram.py` passes.
- Pattern count badge matches the updated `tests/conftest.py` count; `python3 scripts/update-pattern-count.py` produces no diff.
- Full local test suite passes (equivalent to `.github/workflows/pattern-validation.yml`).
- `experiments/README.md` and `experiments/examples/README.md` no longer list: Centralized Rules, Progressive Disclosure, Event Automation, Custom Commands, Image Spec.

title: Epic: Repo consistency + link health alignment
description:
Audit findings (2026-01-31):

- README passes pattern-spec + hyperlink tests (including slow external link check).
- 65 broken internal/relative links across 20 non-README markdown files (mostly stale anchors/paths from pre-migration naming).
- Stable example directories are named correctly, but almost all example READMEs still use pre-migration pattern names (e.g., 'Rules as Code', 'AI Security Sandbox', etc.) and contain stale links.
- Experimental docs/examples still reference old pattern names/anchors and some example READMEs reference missing files.
- CLAUDE.md repo tree is out of date vs current directories.
- index.html drifts from README (missing patterns + category mismatch).

Goal: bring docs/examples/tests/scripts into alignment with pattern-spec.md conventions (names, links, structure) and ensure link integrity repo-wide.

Acceptance:
- All markdown internal/relative links validate repo-wide.
- Examples/docs use current pattern names + anchors.
- CI/tests cover links beyond README.

title: Fix placeholder links in pattern-spec.md
description:
pattern-spec.md currently contains markdown links that are meant to be examples/placeholders (e.g., [Pattern Name](#pattern-name-anchor), examples/pattern-name/). These render as broken links in link-audit tooling and undermine the spec’s own link-integrity guidance.

Scope:
- pattern-spec.md: ensure example link syntax is presented as code/escaped text (not clickable broken links).

Notes:
- Link audit currently reports 4 broken internal/relative links in pattern-spec.md (missing internal anchor + missing file).
acceptance_criteria:
- pattern-spec.md contains no broken internal/relative links when running a repo-wide markdown link audit (excluding code blocks).
- Example link formats remain clear (prefer code formatting/backticks or escaping).
